Stop-loss strategy: Set stop loss at 10% below the buying price and adjust it to the break-even point when the stock price rises by 20%. Criteria for triggering a sell order include a 10% decline in stock price, a significant decrease in EPS, or a substantial increase in DBR.

Trailing stop loss strategy with a 10% stop loss limit, triggered when the stock price falls below 198 NTD or when the company's quarterly financial reports show significant decline in revenue or profitability.
Trailing stop loss with 10% maximum loss, sell if price falls below 198 NTD or if ROE drops below 8%
Trailing stop loss at 10% below the recent high
Trailing stop loss with a 10% threshold, sell if the stock price falls below 198 NTD or if the quarterly EPS growth rate declines by more than 20% for two consecutive quarters.
Trailing stop loss with 10% maximum loss, and sell when the stock price falls below the 50-day moving average or when ROE drops below 8%
Trailing stop loss strategy with a 10% stop loss threshold and a 5% trailing step.
Trailing stop loss with 10% threshold, sell if price falls below 193 NTD or if ROE drops below 8% for two consecutive quarters
Trailing stop loss at 10% below the highest price reached, or a fixed stop loss at 193 NTD
Trailing stop loss with a 10% threshold, sell if price falls below 190 NTD or if ROE drops below 8%
Trailing stop loss strategy with a 10% stop loss limit and a 5% trailing stop loss trigger.
Trailing stop loss at 10% below the recent high
Trailing stop loss with 10% maximum loss, triggered when the stock price falls below the 50-day moving average or a 15% decline from the recent peak.
